Header: Murray battles to three set win over Edmund in DC
Content: Former world number one Andy Murray took another big step in his comeback from hip surgery by beating fellow Brit Kyle Edmund 7-6(4) 1-6 6-4 in the second round of the Citi Open on Wednesday (August 1). The 31-year-old Scot blasted a backhand cross-court return winner on match point to end the two-and-a-half hour contest and dispatch the fourth seed. Alexander Zverev won 82 percent of his first serves in his rain-interrupted match that started on Tuesday against Malek Jaziri en route to a 6-2 6-1 win over the Tunisian. Top seed Zverev will face off Thursday (August 2) with his 15th seeded brother Mischa Zverev who got past American Tim Smyczek 6-2 7-6(7).
